intro: Adenia keramanthus, commonly known as the white belladonna vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its striking white flowers with a strong, unpleasant odor. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
